clinical_study.brief_title: Biliverdin Reductase A in Chronic Hepatitis C Virus Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Biliverdin Reductase A in Chronic Hepatitis C Virus Infection

collaborator.agency: Institute for Clinical and Experimental Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: In this project, the investigators aim to study the role of biliverdin reductase A (BLVRA) in HCV infected patients prior and during/after standard antiviral therapy in association with viral clearance, disease progression and treatment response and in comparison with healthy subjects.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. To analyze biliverdin reductase (BLVRA) expression in the liver of HVC infected patients undergoing liver biopsy followed by standard antiviral treatment (peg-interferon plus ribavirin combination therapy) and patients with other forms of liver diseases undergoing liver biopsy as controls.
2. To analyze BLVRA expression in peripheral blood leukocytes (PBL) of therapeutically naïve HCV patients, during/after standard antiviral therapy and healthy controls.
3. To analyze BVLRA genetic polymorphisms both in HCV infected patients and healthy controls.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess differences in BLVRA expression in the liver and PBMC in HCV infected patients in responders and non-responders to standard antiviral therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: To analyze the association of genetic polymorphisms of BLVRA with disease progression and treatment response in HCV infected patients.

arm_group.description: The study was performed on therapeutically naïve patients with chronic HCV infection. Patients with positivity of anti-HCV antibodies, and detectable HCV RNA in serum for at least 6 months, were included in the study.

study_pop.textblock: Estimated enrollment: BLVRA expression study: 50 - 100 HCV patients 50 healthy volunteers Polymorphisms of BLVRA study: 300 HCV patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
BLVRA expression study
- Therapeutically naïve HCV patients undergoing antiviral treatment with peg-interferon plus ribavirin combination therapy
BLVRA genetic polymorphisms study
- HCV infected patients prior, during, after or without antiviral therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Co-infection with HAV, HBV and HIV
- Disorders of heme metabolism
